arts.ttl: Old Trafford legend's twin sons combine for two goals as Man United's Under 21s thrash West Brom
arts.sum: Manchester United's under-21 side thrashed West Bromwich Albion 5-1 in the Premier League 2 on Friday evening and there was a familiar name on the scoresheet.

arts.ttl: What Hull City boss Ruben Selles said after hard-fought West Brom draw
arts.sum: Results below City went against the Tigers with Derby County and Cardiff City both winning, which cuts their five-point gap to just three with eight games left, but Selles was pleased with a vital result away from home. "At the start of the second half, we were better; we were more competitive.

arts.ttl: Abu Kamara rescues Hull City as forward salvages draw at West Brom
arts.sum: City had to survive a lengthy spell of pressure in and around their box on the 10-minute mark but did, and then fashioned their first opening when Albion failed to clear and Burstow volleyed just over the bar, though back came the hosts with Johnston, allowed to drift in and shoot straight at Pandur. In a scrappy game of few chances, Albion carved out the better of them but the Tigers dragged themselves level when Kamara came off the bench, just as he did on Wednesday against Oxford to have a big involvement, to head in Lewie Coyle's cross to claim a big point on the road.

arts.ttl: Hull City player ratings at West Brom as super-subs secure crucial point
arts.sum: That was as close as the hosts came, while at the other end, City had a flurry of moments they could not make the most of, before Palmer's header was turned in by Kamara. Albion dominated the first half without really forcing Pandur into any serious work bar a Mikey Johnston drive, while Adam Armstrong plugged over from close range.

arts.ttl: Memorable moment for Isaac Price but West Brom are pegged back by Hull
arts.sum: Abu Kamara equalised for the visitors at The Hawthorns.

arts.ttl: Ruben Selles sends Tony Mowbray message as Hull City boss targets West Brom success
arts.sum: Head coach Ruben Selles says it's great to see Tony Mowbray back in the dugout after battling bowel cancer as he prepares to face the experienced manager at West Brom on Saturday. "What they have been building with Carlos and now with Tony is a powerful team for the level, fighting for the play-offs and building step by step as a squad that is very competitive, so I expect a big challenge.

arts.ttl: Hull City stars handed unexpected chance in Championship relegation run-in
arts.sum: City were right to lodge an appeal because there have been enough inconsistencies in refereeing decisions this season to suggest Pedro could have got away with a yellow card. It's perhaps a good job they signed so many players capable of playing in attacking areas because with Louie Barry already sidelined for much of the rest of the season and now Pedro only available for the final seven games, those remaining will need to step up.

arts.ttl: Championship relegation scrap examined as Hull City boost survival hopes
arts.sum: After the damaging defeat at Cardiff City, the Tigers ' prospects of going down to League One increased markedly, but after taking seven points from their last nine games, including wins over relegation rivals Plymouth Argyle and Oxford, the bookies believe Ruben Selles' side will avoid the drop. According to Betfred, the Tigers have just under a six per cent chance of going down, while at the other end of the spectrum, despite their fine away win at Portsmouth, Argyle remain odds on favourites to go back down along with Luton Town and Cardiff.

arts.ttl: Hull City predicted XI for West Brom as Ruben Selles faces midfield conundrum
arts.sum: Puerta will sit the game at The Hawthorns with the Tigers looking for a first win at the home of the Baggies since 2012, along with Joao Pedro, who serves the second of a three-game ban for his sending off at Bristol City a week ago. Selles will be unable to call upon Gustavo Puerta after he was harshly given a second yellow card in the 97th minute of Wednesday night's 2-1 win over Oxford United.

arts.ttl: Tony Mowbray fires West Brom warning ahead of big Hull City Hawthorns meeting
arts.sum: Mowbray is acutely aware of the threat posed by City despite their long list of absences, especially coming on the back of Albion's battling away draw at Turf Moor on Tuesday. "I'm very respectful of Hull having watched a few of their games, they play on the front foot, they're an aggressive team, it's not a game where they will come, sit everybody behind the ball and try to get a draw.
